vars.transcript_text: facing a challenging night this evening. In Ballamina in County Antrim around this time. Last night was really when the trouble broke out initially earlier in the evening. There had been a peaceful march near the city center, attended by hundreds of people protesting about an alleged sexual assault in the town at the weekend. Earlier yesterday. Two teenage boys had appeared in court, charged with the attempted rip of a teenage girl. They were remanded in custody. And they spoke. Via an interpreter in Romanian to confirm their names in the court, which heard that they would be denying those charges. So that demonstration was peaceful. But police say that a number of youths wearing masks broke off from the demonstration. And then began to attack both police officers and the homes of migrants. And today, about half a dozen migrant families have moved out of their homes as a result of what they suffered. Last night, there were four houses set on fire. Windows were smashed of other houses, doors kicked in, and also a number of businesses damaged. Two police officers suffered injuries, 15 of them. Fortunately, all of the minor. [A] Fortunately, all of the minor.
vars.vis_description: masked youths attacking police officers and migrants' homes
